Thriller, starring Elisabeth Moss, Oliver Jackson-Cohen and Harriet Dyer

programme.title: The Dry
programme.desc: Federal agent Aaron Falk returns to his drought-stricken home town after an absence of more than 20 years to attend the funeral of his childhood friend. But his arrival opens up a decades-old wound - the unsolved death of a teenage girl. Crime drama, starring Eric Bana and Genevieve OReilly

programme.title: Collateral
programme.desc: A Los Angeles taxi driver picks up a sharp-suited fare and is shocked when a dead body almost plunges through his windscreen during the first stop on the journey. The enigmatic passenger then reveals he is a hitman with four more contracts to carry out before the night is over, and forces the driver to help him. Michael Manns thriller, starring Tom Cruise and Jamie Foxx

programme.title: Sherlock Holmes
programme.desc: The eccentric detective and his confidant Dr Watson investigate the apparent resurrection of a criminal mastermind with links to the occult, who is carrying out a series of seemingly magical murders. The case is complicated by the reappearance of Holmes duplicitous old flame Irene Adler. Action thriller, starring Robert Downey Jr, Jude Law, Rachel McAdams, Mark Strong and Eddie Marsan

programme.title: Sherlock Holmes: A Game of Shadows
programme.desc: The detective investigates a series of seemingly unconnected crimes all around the world, and becomes convinced one man is behind them all - the elusive Professor Moriarty. He sets forth on an international journey to bring the evil mastermind to justice, but finds he is dealing with a foe who is his intellectual equal. Action thriller sequel, starring Robert Downey Jr, Jude Law, Noomi Rapace and Jared Harris

programme.title: Dirty Harry
programme.desc: Maverick San Francisco detective Dirty Harry Callahan sets out to capture a deranged sniper picking off victims at random. Although his own tactics barely stay within the confines of the law, he is determined the killer will face his particular brand of justice, regardless of his superiors disapproval. Don Siegels thriller, starring Clint Eastwood, Harry Guardino and Andy Robinson

programme.title: Oceans 8
programme.desc: Following in the footsteps of brother Danny, light-fingered Debbie Ocean plans to steal the Toussaint, a $150million necklace from Vogues Met Gala, with the help of a famous actress. Crime caper, starring Sandra Bullock, Cate Blanchett, Anne Hathaway and Mindy Kaling

programme.title: Vantage Point
programme.desc: An assassination attempt is made on the life of the US president during a terrorism summit. The story unfolds from several perspectives, including that of the secret service agents charged with protecting the head of state, a news producer covering the event and a man in the crowd who may have caught the perpetrator on camera. Thriller, starring Dennis Quaid, Matthew Fox, Forest Whitaker, Sigourney Weaver and William Hurt

programme.title: Layer Cake
programme.desc: A London cocaine dealer is all set to leave the criminal world behind and start a new life abroad. However, his plans are thwarted when he is asked to track down a gangsters drug-addicted daughter and locate a stolen shipment of Ecstasy. Crime thriller, starring Daniel Craig, Michael Gambon, Colm Meaney, Kenneth Cranham and Sienna Miller

programme.title: Three Days of the Condor
programme.desc: A bookish CIA researcher returns to his field office to find all his colleagues have been murdered in his absence. When he tries to uncover the truth, he also ends up targeted for assassination by his own agency, and is forced to go on the run to discover the reasons why. Sydney Pollacks thriller, starring Robert Redford, Faye Dunaway, Cliff Robertson and Max von Sydow

programme.title: The Saint
programme.desc: International thief Simon Templar, a cunning master of disguise with a Swiss bank account almost full enough to retire on, accepts one last job - to steal a female scientists formula for cold fusion. However, he breaks his own golden rule by getting emotionally involved with the woman, leading to a deadly chase as the pair meet up in Russia and try to flee from the real bad guys. Action adventure, starring Val Kilmer, Elisabeth Shue and Henry Goodman

programme.title: Absolution
programme.desc: A veteran gangster tries to reconnect with his kids and amend the mistakes of his past, but escaping from his nefarious former colleagues proves harder than expected. Thriller, starring Liam Neeson, Ron Perlman and Frankie Shaw

programme.title: He Went That Way
programme.desc: Animal trainer Jim Goodwin unknowingly picks up a serial killer while on a road trip with his pet chimpanzee. Director Jeffrey Darlings crime drama, starring Zachary Quinto, Jacob Elordi and Troy Adams

programme.title: To Catch a Thief
programme.desc: A retired cat burglar becomes the prime suspect for a series of robberies carried out in his own distinctive style, and sets out to clear his name by catching the copycat crook responsible. His quest takes him to the Cote dAzur, where he encounters the demure daughter of a wealthy holiday-maker, and before long the two are drawn together. Alfred Hitchcocks romantic mystery, starring Cary Grant, Grace Kelly and Jessie Royce Landis

Fact-based disaster drama, with George Clooney, Mark Wahlberg, Diane Lane, John C Reilly and Mary Elizabeth Mastrantonio.

Thriller, starring Michael Douglas, Glenn Close and Anne Archer

She was the first woman to grace the cover of Rolling Stone magazine and dabbled in acting including a memorable performance opposite Mel Gibson in Mad Max Beyond Thunderdome. Following a prolonged period of ill health, Turner intends to retire from the spotlight with her second husband, Erwin Bach. She bids farewell to her fans in the emotional documentary Tina. Directed by Dan Lindsay and TJ Martin, the film invites the singer to reminisce about her turbulent life and career with glowing contributions from friends, family and fans including Oprah Winfrey and Angela Bassett

The castle was also where Dick Turpin was held prior to his execution in 1739 and Dan tries to separate fact from fiction regarding the many myths to have developed about the infamous highwayman

programme.title: Secrets of Great British Castles
programme.desc: Dan Jones explores the 900-year history of Leeds Castle in Kent, from its origins as a royal Saxon familys manor and Norman stronghold to the private property of six medieval queens, a Tudor palace, a Jacobean country house and a Georgian mansion. Its last owner, Lady Olive Baillie, made it a centre of lavish hospitality for leading politicians, international royalty and film stars. When she died in 1974, she bequeathed the castle and grounds to a specially created charitable trust so that future generations could enjoy her home

programme.desc: How, when a century-old extradition treaty between Britain and Spain ended in 1978, the Spanish coast became a safe haven for the mafia and criminal masterminds

programme.title: Gunpowder Siege
programme.desc: The story of the hunt for the men behind the Gunpowder Plot, as Robert Catesby, Thomas Wintour and Thomas Percy desperately sought to ignite a Catholic rebellion

programme.title: Ancient Aliens
programme.desc: Researchers ask if cloud computing represents the rediscovery of an ancient repository of knowledge known as the Akashic Record. Neuroscientist Dr Dario Nardi measures the brainwaves of Dr Deepak Chopra as he enters a state of deep meditation

programme.title: Ancient Aliens: The Ultimate Evidence
programme.desc: Ancient astronaut theorist Giorgio Tsoukalos investigates the mystery of the Nazca Lines, a series of ancient geoglyphs located in the desert area of southern Peru. Documentary exploring claims of supposed extraterrestrial visits to ancient civilizations

programme.title: Alien Files: Unsealed
programme.desc: Giorgio Tsoukalos from Ancient Aliens investigates whether extra-terrestrial beings lie at the heart of some of Earths most famous mysteries

programme.title: Alien Files: Unsealed
programme.desc: Contemplating the motivations behind alien visits to Earth, such as the desire to experiment on the human body and mind

programme.title: Secrets of Great British Castles
programme.desc: Lancaster Castle has witnessed scenes of historical, cultural and political significance throughout the centuries, including incidents of religious persecution, the trials of the Lancashire Witches and 200 public executions. Owned by the Duchy of Lancaster, it was a state prison until 2011 and is still a working crown court. Dan Jones explores its turbulent history and meets Wendy Robinson, a retired prosecutor from Australia, whose ancestors were sentenced to death at Lancaster Crown Court in 1817 for stealing sheep

programme.title: The Great British Dig: History in Your Back Garden
programme.desc: Hugh Dennis and a team of archaeologists and historians descend on a suburban road in Kent where they believe a Roman settlement is hidden beneath the back gardens. With just one week to discover the history that may lie below the terraced houses of Florence Road, Maidstone, Hugh goes door-to-door to recruit willing locals to help Richard Taylor, Chloe Duckworth and Simon Elliott dig up their gardens in the search for remains

programme.title: Auction Hunters
programme.desc: Allen Haff is intrigued by a lot containing high-quality tools and antique furniture, but struggles to outbid his new rival. Plus, a 1930s dynamite detonator box is discovered

programme.title: Pawn Stars
programme.desc: Rick and Corey race to San Diego for a spin in the classic car Hells Chariot from the movie Grease. Chum takes a whack at a Punch-a-Bag game once played by Jack Dempsey

programme.title: Pawn Stars
programme.desc: A customer walks into the pawn shop with a Tommy Boy poster signed by Chris Farley. Meanwhile, Rick tries not to slip up when making a deal on a pair of snowshoes

programme.title: Life After People
programme.desc: Scientists explore how Earth would transform if humans vanished, here considering how the global retail machine would collapse. Shipping lanes would turn explosive and ghostly grocery stores become battlefields for rodents and predators

programme.title: Kevin Costners The West
programme.desc: The Fetterman Fight, also known as the Fetterman Massacre. In 1866 Wyoming, a group of infantry, cavalry, and civilians under the command of Captain William Fetterman was wiped out by thousands of Native warriors of the Lakota Sioux, Northern Cheyenne, and Arapaho tribes. The site of the battle was Fort Phil Kearney, one of many forts along the Bozeman Trail, built to connect settlers to gold mines out West

programme.title: Digging Up Britains Past
programme.desc: Helen Skelton and Alex Langlands explore the history of Stonehenge, examining the stones that make up the structure, their acoustic properties, and how they were transported 120 miles from their origins in Salisbury Plain to form the circle. Helen also visits a village where builders were believed to have lived during the sites construction and meets scientists who have analysed the bodies buried beneath the monument, including the remains of a man who is believed to have come to Stonehenge all the way from Switzerland

programme.title: Digging Up Britains Past
programme.desc: Helen Skelton and Alex Langlands, along with a team of archeologists, explore fascinating periods in British history through a current archaeological dig. In the first episode, Helen and Alex head for the island of Lindisfarne, where archaeologists are trying to locate the site of an eighth-century monastery. Among their finds is a graveyard and a number of skeletons, which may be those of both monks and pilgrims

programme.title: Digging Up Britains Past
programme.desc: In 1592, Elizabeth I visited Sudeley Castle in the Cotswolds for a three-day party commemorating the nations victory over the Spanish Armada. Here, Raksha Dave, Alex Langlands and assorted volunteers and archaeologists hunt for a lost garden planted as part of the celebrations, while there is also a visit to Kenilworth Castle to investigate an Elizabethan garden still in full bloom today. Plus, a look at how the gardens Tudor owner, Robert Dudley transformed his estate to win favour with his Queen

programme.title: Secrets of Great British Castles
programme.desc: Dan Jones heads to the south-east of England to explore the turbulent history of Dover Castle. He reveals that Henry II ordered its construction not only as a statement of royal power, but also out of guilt for the murder of Thomas Becket, the Archbishop of Canterbury, in 1170. Dan discovers how a vast network of tunnels was used to defend the castle, including underground barracks built during the Napoleonic Wars and a nuclear bunker created during the Cold War

programme.title: Secrets of Great British Castles
programme.desc: Dan Jones explores the turbulent history of the Tower of London, which is one of Britains most famous buildings and has been a military fortress, a palace, a royal mint, a prison, a zoo and a place of execution. He reveals how one kings obsession with money led to the Tower becoming the focus of the worst Jewish massacre the country had ever seen and explains how a mob of disgruntled peasants managed to break through its defences as they sought bloody revenge for taxes they could no longer put up with

programme.title: Secrets of Great British Castles
programme.desc: Dan Jones explores the history of Warwick Castle, which started as a motte and bailey fort established by William the Conqueror in 1068 and was transformed into a stone fortress two centuries later by the Beauchamp family. He examines the role Guy Beauchamp played in the kidnapping and murder of one of Edward IIs closest allies and descends into the castles claustrophobic dungeon

programme.title: Secrets of Great British Castles
programme.desc: Dan Jones heads to Gwynedd to explore the history of Caernarfon Castle, the building of which began in 1283 on the orders of Edward I. He demonstrates how the castles vast stone walls and strategically designed towers repelled all enemies, even the Welsh national hero Owain Glyndwr, earning itself a truly forbidding reputation, but its military importance faded at the end of the 15th century when Henry Tudor - a Welshman - made his way on to the English throne

programme.title: The Abyss: Rise and Fall of the Nazis
programme.desc: The defeat at Stalingrad in 1943, which was the turning point of the Second World War and convinced the Nazi leadership to intensify their terror and propaganda campaigns

programme.title: The Abyss: Rise and Fall of the Nazis
programme.desc: A fresh look at the Third Reich from a global and current perspective, telling how the Nazis conquered Germany and then half of Europe within a few years of losing the First World War. The survivors and the winners from the war wanted to blame the Germans. No one knew whether the Germans had really broken with the Nazis

programme.title: Airport Security: USA

programme.title: Royal Autopsy
programme.desc: Professor Alice Roberts delves into the life and death of Anne, Queen of England from 1702 to 1714. Being the last Stuart monarch and getting pregnant at least 17 times. Despite her remarkable fecundity, Queen Anne was not able to produce an heir as most of her pregnancies resulted in miscarriages or stillbirths and none of the live births survived beyond childhood. She suffered from gout for much of her life - so much so, that she even had to be carried to her coronation at Westminster Abbey. The gout rendered her largely immobile in her latter years

programme.title: Witches of Essex

programme.title: The Simpsons

programme.title: The Simpsons
programme.desc: Young Homer and his friends are terrorised by a scary killer clown in a Treehouse of Horror episode parodying Stephen Kings It

programme.title: The Office (US)
programme.desc: Jim learns the downside of management when he is left to inform the staff that not everyone will get a Cola rise. Meanwhile, Dwight tries to gather support against him, and Pam decides she would rather have cash than traditional wedding presents

programme.title: The Office (US)
programme.desc: Part one of two. The Dunder Mifflin staff go to Niagara Falls for Jim and Pams wedding after promising not to mention her pregnancy, but Michael ends up on damage limitation duty

programme.title: The Simpsons
programme.desc: Bart discovers a profitable glitch in an online game and ropes Principal Skinner into his criminal enterprise, while Marge and Maggie discover paradise

programme.title: The Simpsons
programme.desc: Through a series of YouTube recommended videos, the story of the rise and fall of the Simpson family vlog is revealed.

programme.title: Predators
programme.desc: In Zimbabwe, an African wild dog pack find themselves outnumbered by lions and hyenas, and the pups must learn quickly if the pack is to survive

programme.title: Jack Reacher
programme.desc: A former army sniper is arrested following a random shooting that leaves five people dead, but protests his innocence. An elusive former military police investigator is called in to examine the case, and becomes convinced a conspiracy is at work. Action thriller based on Lee Childs novel One Shot, starring Tom Cruise, Rosamund Pike, Werner Herzog and Robert Duvall

programme.title: Last Week Tonight with John Oliver
programme.desc: American talk show in which British comedian, actor and writer John Oliver presents a satirical look at the biggest news stories, political developments and pop culture events of the previous seven days. The topical series sees the former Daily Show reporter offer his distinct take on a variety of social, political and existential issues facing society

programme.title: Curb Your Enthusiasm
programme.desc: The Davids take in a family whose home was destroyed by a hurricane, and Larry devises a way of avoiding parties he does not want to attend. Comedy, guest starring Vivica A Fox and Tia Carrere, with Larry David and Cheryl Hines

programme.title: Curb Your Enthusiasm
programme.desc: Larrys prized New York Yankees jersey goes missing while it is being dry cleaned and he is annoyed to be upstaged by an anonymous donor at a ceremony where a hospital wing is being named after him. The Blacks and the Davids experience a moving day, and Cheryl is disturbed by a distasteful stain on a guest-room quilt

programme.title: The Force: North East
programme.desc: New homeowners get a shock when they discover a cannabis farm in their loft, while officers investigate after getting a tip-off about some forged cash

programme.title: Live ICC Womens World Cup
programme.sub-title: ICC Womens ODI World Cup Final: India v South Africa 02.11
programme.desc: India v South Africa. Coverage of the final, which takes place at DY Patil Stadium in Navi Mumbai, India. Australia have been the most successful team in World Cups, winning the title seven times and have won three of the last five tournaments to take place since 2005. New Zealand and England are the only other two countries to win this competition, with the Kiwis last winning in 2000 and England last succeeding in 2017

programme.title: ICC Womens World Cup
programme.desc: England v India. Action from the 2017 final, which took place at Lords, as the teams looked to succeed Australia as champions. These teams faced each other in the opening round of the round-robin fixtures, and on that occasion it was India who came out on top, winning by 35 runs

programme.title: Live ICC Womens World Cup
programme.sub-title: ICC Womens ODI World Cup Final: India v South Africa 02.11
programme.desc: India v South Africa. Coverage of the final, which takes place at DY Patil Stadium in Navi Mumbai, India. Australia have been the most successful team in World Cups, winning the title seven times and have won three of the last five tournaments to take place since 2005. New Zealand and England are the only other two countries to win this competition, with the Kiwis last winning in 2000 and England last succeeding in 2017

programme.title: Live Super Sunday
programme.desc: West Ham United v Newcastle United (Kick-off 2.00pm). All the action from the Premier League match at London Stadium. A 63rd-minute goal by captain Bruno Guimaraes gave Newcastle a 1-0 in last seasons corresponding fixture. The Hammers have struggled in the early stages of the current campaign, but the Magpies are also yet to find their best form on a consistent basis

programme.title: Live Premier League
programme.desc: Manchester City v Bournemouth (Kick-off 4.30pm). All the action from the Premier League match at Etihad Stadium. The Citizens claimed a 3-1 win over Bournemouth here last term thanks to goals by Omar Marmoush, Bernardo Silva and Nico Gonzalez, with both teams ending the match with 10 men after Mateo Kovacic and Lewis Cook were sent off in the second half

programme.title: Travel Man: 48 Hours In
programme.desc: Richard Ayoade returns with the offbeat tourism show and is joined in the first edition by comedy actress and writer Dawn French, with the pair spending two days in the Greek capital. Their mini-break features doughnuts, the Acropolis and the thermal waters of Lake Vouliagmeni, which is rumoured to be the goddess Athenas favourite bathing spot. Richard and Dawn sample a 14-course tasting menu at a temple to molecular gastronomy, before they go on an Olympic tour featuring discus and javelin training

programme.title: Hairy Bikers Best of British
programme.desc: Si King and Dave Myers explore how Mediterranean cuisine and ingredients have influenced British culinary culture since it was first introduced by the Romans, and prepare their favourite recipes

programme.title: Mortimer and Whitehouse: Gone Fishing
programme.desc: Bob Mortimer and Paul Whitehouse embark on more angling trips round the UK, beginning by heading to North Uist in the Outer Hebrides. Completely unlike anywhere they have fished before, this small, remote and beautiful island has an intricate network of tidal pools and sea lochs, making it near enough equal parts land and water and therefore the perfect place to fish for sea trout

programme.title: Mortimer and Whitehouse: Gone Fishing
programme.desc: Bob and Paul accept an invitation to fish in the estate lake of Burghley House, a 16th-century country house near Stamford in Lincolnshire. Built in the 16th century by William Cecil, Elizabeth Is lord high chancellor, Burghley House is home to some of the most majestic landscapes Paul and Bob have ever found themselves in

programme.title: Guy Martin: Proper Jobs
programme.desc: The presenter follows in the footsteps of his brother and sister when he trains to become a firefighter in some scarily real environments at a fire station in Grimsby

programme.title: Top Gear
programme.desc: Jeremy Clarkson and James May encounter artillery shells, corsets and classic hot hatchbacks as they take a nostalgic look at French company Peugeot, while Richard Hammond is at the test track to compare the Porsche Cayman GTS with the latest Chevrolet Corvette. James also takes the 950bhp LaFerrari hybrid hypercar out for a spin in Italy, and singer Olly Murs is the Star in the Reasonably Priced Car

programme.title: Top Gear
programme.desc: Richard Hammond is dropped into the remote, frozen wastes of Canada to test a watch with a built-in emergency beacon. The distress signal is sent directly to Jeremy Clarkson and James May, who get their hands on two machines and set off on an epic adventure to find their colleague. Jeremy puts the 471bhp Lexus RC F coupe thought its paces, and actress Gillian Anderson takes to the track in the Reasonably Priced Car

programme.title: Storage Hunters UK
programme.desc: Sean Kelly and the bidders are looking for treasure in Somersets storage units, where a bouncy castle and an air boat are among the finds

programme.title: Storage Hunters UK
programme.desc: Heavy D is in town and is prepared to risk having his fingers burned for the chance of a big score, while auctioneer Sean Kelly keeps a watchful eye

programme.title: Storage Hunters UK
programme.desc: Sean Kelly and the hunters are off to Leeds, where a new pair of bidders arrive - and they are not afraid to throw their weight around. Meanwhile, Sam and Ione re-ignite their feud

programme.title: Storage Hunters UK
programme.desc: Sean Kelly oversees UK bidders looking for treasures in Ipswich. With Heavy D back in town the bargaining buccaneers are being driven mad by the booming bidder

programme.title: Hairy Bikers Best of British
programme.desc: Si King and Dave Myers prepare a selection of extravagant British gourmet dishes, using high-quality ingredients including lobster, truffles, prime cuts of meat and expensive chocolate. The duo also explore the stories behind the recipes

programme.title: Hairy Bikers Best of British

programme.title: Turkey with Simon Reeve
programme.desc: In the second half of the journey, Simon travels along the Black Sea Coast to the capital of Ankara and the Northern Highlands, witnessing first hand the aftermath of fighting in Kurdish areas and meeting a conservationist attempting to preserve the regions brown bears. He then returns to Istanbul, where he takes part in a popular TV series set in the palace of the Ottoman Sultans

programme.title: Travel Man: 48 Hours In
programme.desc: Richard Ayoade is joined by comedian Nish Kumar for a short break in Portugals second city, starting their trip with a welcome tipple of its eponymous fortified wine. To get their bearings, they hire electric scooters and refuel with Portos favourite sandwich, the meaty francesinha, before having a 5D cinema experience and climbing the Arrabida bridge. Nish makes a confession at a church, and then the duo indulge in a selection of local pastries with a cake connoisseur, and test out artisanal soap

programme.title: Cannonball
programme.desc: Andrew Flintoff hosts the action-packed game show, in which 24 contestants are tasked with traversing a series of water-based challenges and custom-made inflatable obstacles, each designed to test their speed, accuracy, height and distance. The most successful contestants then claim a chance to launch themselves cannonball-style at a moving target on the surface of a deep-water tank, all in the hope of nabbing the shows priceless Cannonball Cup. Frankie Bridge, Radzi Chinyanganya, Ryan Hand and Maya Jama all join Andrew at the poolside to commentate on the action

programme.title: Border Force: Americas Gatekeepers
programme.desc: Officers in Hidalgo are forced to close the bridge when its stormed by dozens of asylum seekers trying to jump the queue of people waiting to seek refuge in the USA

programme.title: Border Force: Americas Gatekeepers
programme.desc: A 12-year-old boy turns up at one of the bridges on his own, claiming that his mother has been kidnapped by the cartels and he has been living on the streets

programme.title: Train Rescue Down Under
programme.desc: The Ghans maintenance team must race to ensure the train departs the next day, and a routine job on a Queensland Rail commuter train hits a snag

programme.title: Train Rescue Down Under
programme.desc: The construction of a 130-tonne locomotive in Newcastle is nearing the finish line, and an overnight crew must get a Brisbane train on track before the morning commute

programme.title: Special Ops: Crime Squad UK
programme.desc: Britains most talented detectives pursue two gunmen killers in Northamptonshire, distraction burglars in sleepy Kent, and a multi-million-pound footwear scam in Manchester

programme.title: Special Ops: Crime Squad UK
programme.desc: Britains most talented detectives pursue a violent drug gang in Gloucester, an aggressive mugger in sleepy Kent, and a gang of men stealing Britains history in Cheshire

programme.title: Extreme Salvage Squad
programme.desc: Team Salvage are tasked with refloating a pre-World War II boat, but on the way to the site, team leader Luke receives an emergency SOS about another mission

programme.title: Top Gear
programme.desc: Jeremy Clarkson attempts to build a car that is even smaller than the Peel P50 and then tests it out on the streets of London before pitching his concept in the Dragons Den. James May puts the Bentley Continental GT Speed through its paces by taking it on a rally stage, while Richard Hammond drives the new Pagani Huayra hypercar before handing it over to the Stig. Actor Damian Lewis goes for a spin in the Reasonably Priced Car

programme.title: Top Gear
programme.desc: The trio of motoring enthusiasts embark on another epic road trip, this time across western America in front-engined supercars. Jeremy Clarkson pilots the Lexus LFA, which has a spectacularly high-revving V10 powerplant, Richard Hammond gets behind the wheel of the muscular Dodge Viper, and James May opts for a recent incarnation of Aston Martins Vanquish. On their journey from Las Vegas to Palm Springs via Los Angeles, the presenters tackle racing circuits and find themselves in a race against the police, before rushing to the Mexican border - and theres a terrifying penalty for the last man to arrive. Meanwhile, Fleetwood Mac drummer Mick Fleetwood rolls up his sleeves to thrash the Reasonably Priced Car

programme.title: Hairy Bikers Best of British
programme.desc: Si King and Dave Myers examine food found in British woodlands, preparing a wild boar ragu and a creamy fool with brambles picked from a hedgerow. They also explore the long history of poaching in the UK and show which plants can be used to make medicine

programme.title: Rick Steins Mediterranean Escapes
programme.desc: The chef samples Mediterranean food and visits his favourite places in the region. In the first programme he catches a ferry to the mountainous island of Corsica, where he tastes sausages and sheeps cheese, and discovers the locals have a passion for chestnuts

programme.title: Would I Lie to You?
programme.desc: Claudia Winkleman, the Rev Kate Bottley, Sara Barron and Ed Gamble join host Rob Brydon and regular captains David Mitchell and Lee Mack on the comedy panel show. As usual, the participants set out to hoodwink their opponents with absurd facts and plausible fibs about themselves in a bid to secure a team victory, through rounds such as Home Truths and Quick-fire Lies

programme.title: Richard Osmans House of Games
programme.desc: Matt Edmondson, Sabrina Grant, Andy Hamilton and Kirsty Wark test their general knowledge in a variety of trivia-based games across the week, with a winner declared on Friday

programme.title: Richard Osmans House of Games
programme.desc: Michelle Collins, Reginald D Hunter, Joanne McNally and Bill Turnbull test their general knowledge skills in a trivia-based games across the week, with a winner declared on Friday

programme.title: Have I Got a Bit More News for You
programme.desc: BBC Breakfast presenter Steph McGovern takes over the reins for extended edition of the satirical quiz from April 2019, with journalist Ash Sarkar and comedian Josh Widdicombe joining team captains Ian Hislop and Paul Merton to poke fun at the stories making the headlines

programme.title: QI XL
programme.desc: Stephen Fry hosts an extended version of the quiz with a difference, with comedians Phill Jupitus, Josh Widdicombe and Sara Pascoe joining regular panellist Alan Davies to answer questions on the topic of monsters

programme.title: 8 Out of 10 Cats
programme.desc: Irreverent panel show hosted by Jimmy Carr, in which team captains Rob Beckett and Aisling Bea are joined by Kerry Godliman, Georgia Toffolo, Kiri Pritchard-McLean and Fin Taylor

programme.title: Mock the Week
programme.desc: Dara O Briain and Hugh Dennis look back at some of the news from the week with guests Angela Barnes, Alasdair Beckett-King, Rhys James, Ria Lina and Josh Pugh

programme.title: Would I Lie to You?
programme.desc: Footballer-turned-property expert Dion Dublin, comedians Bob Mortimer and Lucy Porter, and entertainer Debbie McGee join host Rob Brydon and regular captains David Mitchell and Lee Mack on the comedy panel show. As usual, the participants aim to hoodwink their opponents with absurd facts and plausible lies about themselves in a bid to secure a team victory

programme.title: Australian Ninja Warrior
programme.desc: 50 new competitors face the Ninja course in the third heat, but three new obstacles - The Bomb Slider, The Cargo with Lache, and The Ball and Chain - make their debut as well

programme.title: Travel Man: 48 Hours In
programme.desc: Richard Ayoade is joined by TV and radio presenter Alice Levine for a packed two-day break in the Estonian capital Tallinn. The pair head to the top of the countrys tallest building, while Alice gives a masterclass in TV presenting, and they walk through a thousand years of Estonian history - including peeping Toms and a cold-war cocktail. They also visit an old KGB outpost, try the sport of kick sledging and sample some new Baltic cuisine, before boarding a submarine for an end-of-trip recap

programme.title: Birds of a Feather
programme.desc: Sharon, Tracey and Dorien manage to convince themselves Princess Diana has bought a local mansion, and enthusiastically prepare for the arrival of royal neighbours - will their attempts to raise Chigwells social standing end in tears? Comedy, starring Pauline Quirke, Linda Robson and Lesley Joseph

programme.title: The Bill
programme.desc: Stamp anxiously awaits his disciplinary hearing, knowing that with 11 previous accidents to his credit, hes probably in for a bumpy ride. Meanwhile, Beech is alarmed to discover one of his old flames is working for the Complaints Investigation Bureau, and makes it his business to find out who she is investigating. Starring Graham Cole, Gemma Craven and Samantha Bond

programme.title: The Bill
programme.desc: Pc Stamp gets back behind the wheel of the area car for the first time since the fatal accident, hoping to lay the matter to rest once and for all. Unfortunately, someone isnt about to let him forget the incident in a hurry. Elsewhere, WPc Hagen poses as a prostitute to catch a slimy solicitor. Graham Cole and Samantha Robson star

programme.title: The Bill
programme.desc: New arrival DC Kerry Holmes finds herself partnered with DS Boulton, who makes it clear that he doesnt have a high opinion of female detectives. To make matters worse, she fails to prevent a pair of villains making a getaway _ but manages to save the day by living up to her nickname Sherlock. Starring Russell Boulter and Joy Brook

programme.title: The Bill
programme.desc: DI Frank Burnside makes a dramatic return to Sun Hill after six years unexplained absence. When Carver and Boulton discover their old colleague mingling with big-time Manchester crooks, they begin to wonder if hes betrayed everything he used to stand for. Starring Chris Ellison, Russell Boulter and Mark Wingett

programme.title: The Bill
programme.desc: Burnside finds himself on the wrong side of the law after making his return to Sun Hill. Chris Ellison stars

programme.title: Call the Midwife
programme.desc: The nuns and midwives are busy preparing for Sister Evangelinas surprise jubilee celebrations, marking 50 years since she took her vows, but a face from the past threatens to ruin the party for the guest of honour. Its back to business when a young woman with Downs syndrome is brought in feeling unwell. To everyones surprise, they discover she is six months pregnant, causing some of them to think the worst, and the staff are joined by new nurse Patsy, whose sense of humour and no-nonsense attitude make her an instant hit

programme.title: Call the Midwife
programme.desc: Trixie is chuffed when local curate Tom invites her to join him for a day of cricket, sending her to work with a spring in her step. Is love on the cards for the young midwife? Shelaghs infertility has made her think long and hard about what she wants in life, so she approaches her husband with an idea, while Patsy upsets a young mother in the clinic and is moved to the district rota, where she works tirelessly to diagnose a dockers unusual symptoms

programme.title: Catherine Cooksons The Secret
programme.desc: Feature-length dramatisation of the writers only thriller, set in 19th-century Tyneside. Colin Buchanan stars as successful businessman Freddie Musgrave, who has worked hard for 20 years to live down his misspent youth as runner to a gang of smugglers and is shocked when a face appears from long ago, threatening to reveal the details of his sordid past. With Clare Higgins and June Whitfield

programme.title: Last Tango in Halifax
programme.desc: Alan and Celias disappearance has everyone in a panic, so a search party is organised, and when Gillian and Caroline come together in their shared concern, the future step-sisters forge a new bond. Meanwhile, oblivious to all the fuss they have caused, the elderly lovebirds are locked in the spooky Southowram Hall - but while she is worried ghosts are present, he is secretly concerned about chest pains. Sally Wainwrights drama, starring Derek Jacobi, Anne Reid, Sarah Lancashire and Nicola Walker

programme.title: Sister Boniface Mysteries
programme.desc: CC Lowsley is totally preoccupied with his upcoming amateur production of The Cursed Arrow. When an actor in the company is murdered, Sister Boniface uncovers a historical motive. Drama, starring Lorna Watson

programme.title: Silent Witness
programme.desc: Feature-length episode. The team is baffled by the conflicting possible motives after two women are shot dead in a house basement - and the investigation isnt helped by Jack having to work alongside an old flame, the ambitious DI Chrissy Reed. Meanwhile, Leo faces a difficult choice when he is asked to prove his pathologist mentor made a mistake in a case that resulted in a mother being imprisoned for smothering her baby to death. Emilia Fox, William Gaminara and David Caves star

programme.title: Gunpowder
programme.desc: Following the death of Elizabeth I, King James of Scotland claims the English throne, and the country goes to war with Catholic Spain. As a result, English Catholics are persecuted and driven into hiding, but after witnessing the brutal means by which the Crown intends to punish his people for practicing their faith, recusant Catholic Robert Catesby devises a treasonous plot to assassinate King James. However, he must first enlist the aid of stalwart allies, and heads to Brussels to seek the help of a hardened war veteran named Guy Fawkes. Three-part historical drama, starring Kit Harington as Catesby - his own ancestor - alongside Liv Tyler, Mark Gatiss, Derek Riddell and Tom Cullen

programme.title: Gunpowder
programme.desc: The Kings network of spies begins to close the net around the Catholic conspirators, and while Catesby and Wintour seek to recruit more allies to their cause in mainland Europe, Lord Cecil puts the pressure on Lady Anne to reveal her cousins whereabouts. On their return to London, the plotters convene for the first time, and decide their moment to strike must be November 5, at the opening of Parliament. However, they must first secure gunpowder, and when a threat of detection leads to a bloody clash, Catesby puts his life on the line in an all-or-nothing mission at the Tower of London. Historical drama, starring Kit Harington, Liv Tyler and Mark Gatiss

programme.title: Gunpowder
programme.desc: November 4th arrives, and with state opening looming on the horizon, Catesby and his co-conspirators load the tunnels below Parliament with barrels of gunpowder. Across the city, Father Garnet faces pressure from an ally to break his seal of confession and reveal the plot to the authorities - for the good of the already-oppressed Catholic faith. However, should the priest prove to be steadfast in his support of the would-be assassins, Lord Cecil may yet have another means by which to end Catesbys mission. Historical drama, starring Kit Harington, Mark Gatiss, Liv Tyler and Peter Mullan

programme.title: Sister Boniface Mysteries
programme.desc: When a police team-building trip takes a sinister turn Sister Boniface must discover which of their rivals is a murderer

programme.title: Doctors
programme.desc: A girl taking care of her depressed father suddenly becomes a devout Muslim and dresses in a hijab, while Michelle gives Vera an opportunity to apologise. Medical drama, starring Donnaleigh Bailey and Dona Croll

programme.title: Doctors
programme.desc: A good Samaritan considers whether walking by may have been the better option when a man collapses in the street. The team have something to celebrate, but when Nick gets drunk and George offers to drive him home, the pair face terrible consequences

programme.desc: Sam takes control of her future by asking Ric an unexpected question and Mubbs hot date with Keri goes well until they are interrupted by her mother, forcing him to scuttle off red-faced. Abs spends his last day in a terrible mood, which is lifted only by a visit from Tess, while Adam is led astray by the woman he woke up in bed with and makes a mistake - for which Toby takes the blame

programme.title: The Bill
programme.desc: Santini becomes a hero after he attempts to save a drowning man, but soon finds himself in trouble with his colleagues again when a package of drugs goes missing

programme.desc: As Laurens trial begins, Max holds her fate in his hands; can he persuade the jury of her innocence? Mo discovers that Brenda has a secret, and Phil makes grim plans

programme.desc: Max persuades Stacey to testify at Laurens trial, but will his plan backfire? Meanwhile, Patricks chat with Tommy turns sour as Tommys murky past is revealed

programme.title: Soldier, Soldier
programme.desc: The lads reach South Africa where they help complete the building of a medical centre, leading to romance for Jeremy, who falls for one of the nurses. Meanwhile, Andy Butcher lands himself in deep trouble after a kind-hearted gesture to help a destitute local family leads to accusations of ivory-poaching

programme.title: Bergerac

programme.title: Terry and June
programme.desc: Terry advertises his snooker table for sale in the local paper, but a mix-up over telephone numbers leads him to think he has a priceless piece of property on his hands. Jack Haig guest stars

programme.desc: The mischievous trio come to the aid of an old friend with an unusual medical problem, while Ivy becomes increasingly irate that no one will fix the cafe roof

However, the Lord Chancellors department once again try to divert the course of justice to avoid embarrassment - and Deeds ex-wife is appointed counsel for the defence. Legal drama, starring Martin Shaw and Jenny Seagrove

programme.desc: A body is found, prompting two people to confess to murder. Alun Armstrong and James Bolam star

programme.desc: Part two of two. DS Boyd uncovers evidence casting doubt on Annie Keels confession and suggesting she is innocent of the two murders. However, her son Sam who was present on the night and holds the key to what really happened has disappeared. Lynda Bellingham guest stars

Comedy, starring Joe Wilkinson, Diane Morgan, Sue Johnston and Bobby Ball

programme.title: The Cockfields
programme.desc: Saturday finds everyone visiting Aunty Rose in the nursing home so she can give Simon a somewhat unorthodox birthday present, while Simon and Donna reluctantly join the family to see Alan Titchmarshs new house. Later, on a cliff top walk, David updates the family on his disastrous love life, and Sue confides in Simon that theyre thinking of moving as the house is feeling too big. Comedy, starring Joe Wilkinson, Diane Morgan, Sue Johnston and Bobby Ball

programme.title: The Cockfields
programme.desc: Sunday finds preparations for Simons 40th birthday in full swing - amid much stress levels. Larry arrives with a very hungover Melissa, who immediately disrupts proceedings. After an awkward lunch its present time and Larry gives Simon a red leather jacket which, to Rays delight, looks ridiculous on him. Eventually Melissa joins the party, but rejects Sues food. Simon tries to defend his fathers behaviour to Ray and an argument ensues until David drops a bombshell that makes Simons birthday one hell never forget. Comedy, starring Joe Wilkinson, Diane Morgan, Sue Johnston and Bobby Ball

programme.desc: The staff are called to stand in for Mr Partridge as childrens entertainers - much to their dismay. But all is not lost when Ted and Spike see a tramp keeping the kids on the beach amused and believe he may be the answer to all their problems

programme.title: Blackadder
programme.desc: A morale-boosting stage show offers Captain Blackadder a route out of the trenches, but he soon finds his plans heading for disaster when Gen Melchett falls for the leading lady - Lt George. First World War comedy, with Rowan Atkinson, Tony Robinson and Hugh Laurie

programme.title: Dads Army
programme.desc: Captain Mainwaring and the platoon are asked to provide a guard of honour for a royal train carrying George VI that is passing through Walmington-on-Sea, but another locomotive confounds their plans. Classic comedy first broadcast in 1973, starring Arthur Lowe, John Le Mesurier and Clive Dunn

programme.title: The Good Life
programme.desc: Tom considers leaving Surbiton to live on a farm, and the couple receive help with their pigs from a passing boar-walker. Sitcom, starring Richard Briers, Felicity Kendal, Penelope Keith and Paul Eddington

programme.title: The Good Life
programme.desc: Tom and Barbaras visits to evening classes become unusually productive, while Margo struggles to master pottery. Comedy, starring Felicity Kendal and Richard Briers

programme.title: The Good Life
programme.desc: Barbara and Tom look for new ways to organise their work so that their early morning activities wont disturb Margo and Jerry. Comedy, starring Richard Briers and Felicity Kendal

programme.title: The Good Life
programme.desc: When Perky the pig gives birth to her litter in the middle of the night, Margo and Jerry agree they must try to help the runt survive - but Jerry is stopped for speeding on the way to hospital to obtain vital oxygen. With Richard Briers, Felicity Kendal, Penelope Keith and Paul Eddington

programme.title: Gavin and Stacey
programme.desc: The newlyweds return from their honeymoon to a big welcome from both their families. However, Smithy seems disconcerted by his pals return and Nessa makes a confession that spoils the happy occasion. Comedy, starring Mathew Horne, James Corden and Joanna Page

programme.title: Gavin and Stacey
programme.desc: Smithy goes missing following Nessas shocking revelation, and the boys try to track him down to persuade him to accept his responsibilities. Meanwhile, Stacey is forced to contemplate the consequences of transforming her long-distance relationship with Gavin into a functioning marriage

programme.title: Not Going Out
programme.desc: Lees attempt to impress Lucy with his knowledge of the art world backfires when she decides to invest a fortune in an unknown artists work. Comedy, starring Lee Mack and Sally Bretton

programme.title: The Cockfields
programme.desc: Saturday finds everyone visiting Aunty Rose in the nursing home so she can give Simon a somewhat unorthodox birthday present, while Simon and Donna reluctantly join the family to see Alan Titchmarshs new house. Later, on a cliff top walk, David updates the family on his disastrous love life, and Sue confides in Simon that theyre thinking of moving as the house is feeling too big. Comedy, starring Joe Wilkinson, Diane Morgan, Sue Johnston and Bobby Ball

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home

programme.title: Tipping Point
programme.desc: Ben Shephard hosts the quiz in which contestants answer questions to win turns on an arcade-style machine. Dropping tokens down a choice of four chutes, they hope to knock piles of them off a moving shelf - and the more they collect, the greater the prize fund. The player who has won the least amount is then eliminated, and the last one standing competes for a £10,000 jackpot

programme.title: Ski AandE
programme.desc: Rescue and medical teams in a ski resort deal with extreme conditions and daily accidents on the slopes of the French Alps. A pensioner cannot remember what day it is

programme.title: Ski AandE
programme.desc: The changing weather causes difficulties on the mountains as the teams rescue a man who has cut open his face and a woman who has fallen 13 metres without a helmet

programme.title: Ski AandE
programme.desc: Ski Patrol and the medics deal with emergencies, including a heli-rescue from a mountain, a little boy with slashed fingers and a woman whose leg has, as one medic says, ‘exploded

programme.title: Ski AandE
programme.desc: Featuring people who pay the price for white-knuckle thrills, including a netball umpire who receives heartbreaking news and an elderly Canadian who stabs his face on a ski pole

programme.title: Ski AandE
programme.desc: The teams deal with the range of emergencies that occur in the Val Thorens snowpark, including a teenager who has concussion and a man who breaks his spine

programme.title: The Supervet
programme.desc: As the festive season approaches at Fitzpatrick Referrals, Professor Noel and his team treat three special patients. A one-year-old crossbreed puppy rescued by a charity from Romania is in need of complex surgery, with no guarantee of success. An eight-year-old Dalmatian needs work on its spinal cord, and a Labrador from Switzerland is having trouble walking. Noels investigations reveal problems with both shoulder and elbow, an unusual combination that requires dramatic intervention

programme.title: The Supervet
programme.desc: Noel Fitzpatrick treats Koa, a six-month-old Bouvier des Flandres who is suffering from a badly deformed back leg, causing huge pain. Patricia brings her beloved 11-year-old Rhodesian ridgeback, Kwanda, to Fitzpatricks Guildford hospital with an eye infection that she fears may be the sign of something more sinister. Dr Laurent Findji confirms it is bad news - a malignant tumour

programme.title: Pete Wicks: For Dogs Sake
programme.sub-title: Hugo and the Ice Cream Pups
programme.desc: Pete meets some newborn pups fighting to survive, and helps teach Hugo, a Cane Corso rescued from quarantine at Dover, how to be a dog

programme.title: Inside the Ambulance
programme.desc: Jo and Ash deal with a patient whos struggling to breathe, while Joel and Nic treat a man whos fallen from a ladder while wielding a hedge trimmer

programme.title: Inside the Ambulance
programme.desc: Mick and Rachel help an amateur stunt driver who has crash-landed and damaged his back, while Lee and Stef are called to a lady with multiple allergies whos suffered a seizure

programme.title: Inside the Operating Theatre
programme.desc: An eight-year-old is having an operation to straighten his squint, a man needs an ultrasound to confirm whether he has cancer and a new mum is having her wisdom teeth removed

programme.title: Inside the Operating Theatre
programme.desc: A 15-year-old has four baby teeth that have not fallen out and need removing, a man is having his urethra widened so that a camera can pass into his bladder to check his cancer has not returned and a woman needs an operation to stop her persistent nose bleeds

programme.title: One Born Every Minute
programme.desc: Sarah and Jonathan met at junior school as eight-year-olds and were best friends for years until they eventually got together. Now theyre in Southmead expecting their second baby, but the mother-to-be is getting increasingly anxious and the memory of her difficult first labour begins to induce a panic attack. Meanwhile, Vikki and Jack are having their first child and are keen for a big family after going through lonely and troubled upbringings themselves, while Naomi has to spend the night in hospital away from her partner Chris as she waits for labour to kick in

programme.title: One Born Every Minute
programme.desc: Nicola and Tim, who are both nurses, hope their second childs birth will be less dramatic than their first, who was born after an emergency C-section. Expectant mum Laura, 29, has battled anorexia nervosa since she was a teenager and was told she would never be able to have children because of the impact of her eating disorder. However, she and partner Delroy are now looking forward to the arrival of baby number three. Tracy is days past her due date and her little one is refusing to make an appearance

programme.title: My Family
programme.desc: Susan is outraged when Ben, ever the romantic, buys her a vacuum cleaner for Christmas, so in a desperate attempt to make amends, he gets her a necklace instead. However, when he discovers it for sale at half the price the following day, he is determined to return it and buy it again at the bargain rate - but the no-nonsense jeweller (guest star Julian Clary) is having none of it. To make matters worse, Susan turns up and the Harpers end up getting trapped in the department store overnight. Meanwhile, Janey, Michael and Alfie decide to give Susan and Ben a thoughtful present for a change, but despite their best efforts, it does not turn out quite as planned. Robert Lindsay and Zoe Wanamaker star in the festive special from 2008

programme.title: My Family
programme.desc: With Christmas approaching, the Harpers spend a day shopping and getting into the festive spirit, but their joy proves short-lived when their tube train suddenly grinds to a halt and they face the prospect of spending the holiday on the Underground. Christmas special of the sitcom from 2003, with a guest appearance by Richard Whiteley

programme.title: One Born Every Minute
programme.desc: A 19-year-old looks forward to becoming a mother after being told she might never get pregnant. Meanwhile, a woman who is terrified of needles dreads the prospect of undergoing an epidural, and a lesbian couple prepare for the birth of their second child

programme.title: Property Brothers: Forever Homes
programme.desc: After her husbands unexpected death, a mother of two is left with a house they had planned on renovating together. Jonathan and Drew step in to help

programme.title: Property Brothers: Forever Homes
programme.desc: A couple moved to be closer to an amazing Deaf and Hard of Hearing school programme for their daughter. They love the neighbourhood now, but their home needs a revamp

programme.title: Property Brothers: Forever Homes
programme.desc: After their twins are born, Nick and Nina decide to move in to Ninas childhood home with her mum. Can Jonathan and Drew transform the place to make it work for everyone?

programme.title: DIY SOS
programme.desc: The team heads to Birmingham to transform the family home of parents Charlotte and Chris, whose twins were born prematurely and have a condition known as global development delay. It has slowed down their progress of walking and talking, but they are further hindered by their cramped house. Nick Knowles and the team join forces with a host of volunteers from the local community to rebuild the familys life and give them a better future

programme.title: DIY SOS
programme.desc: Nick Knowles travels to Hopesay, Shropshire to meet ex-fireman Joe and his seven-year-old daughter Lucy. Joe lost his wife Jess suddenly in 2014, partway through renovating an old cottage into what they had hoped would be a dream family home. Now work has ground to a halt and Joe and his daughter are living in a tiny caravan in the garden. Having heard of their plight, the DIY SOS team arrives to give them the home Jess had wanted for them, backed up by an army of local tradespeople

programme.title: DIY SOS
programme.desc: The team help Scott Jones, a 17-year-old disabled athlete in Cheltenham, who is eager to become more self-sufficient at home, with the challenge including added side and rear extensions, a wet room, access to an adapted kitchen and a state-of-the-art gym studio. Scott won gold at the 2013 IPC world championships and aims to develop his talents in order to participate at the 2020 Paralympics in Tokyo

programme.title: MasterChef Australia: Dessert Masters
programme.desc: The contestants enter the kitchen to find performers from Cirque du Soleil putting on an amazing display, and must then create a circus-inspired dish to win immunity

programme.title: Inside the Ambulance
programme.desc: Its Christmas Day and Richard and Adam help a family who tragically face the loss of a loved one, while Dan and Becky are called out to a baby with a worryingly high temperature

programme.title: Pete Wicks: For Dogs Sake
programme.desc: Pete helps a withdrawn pregnant Malinois regain strength so she can care for her 11 lively pups, and falls for Winter, a Staffie who is covered in scars

programme.title: The Supervet
programme.desc: Noel treats an 11-month-old dog who has a severely dislocated hip which Noel suspects is the result of trauma experienced at the tender age of only two months. Elsewhere, overweight Labradoodle Fletcher is brought into the veterinary practice all the way from Scotland after previous surgery to fix a bad ankle fracture has failed, and a tiny hedgehog needs treatment on his broken hind legs

programme.title: The Supervet
programme.desc: Noel suspects that an 18-month-old Australian Shepherd dog may be suffering from nerve compression, and an 11-month-old pug shows signs of neurological damage. It transpires that she has bone malformation that is squashing her spinal cord. Elsewhere, there is an emergency admission when a Jack Russell puppy called Bella is rushed in with a crushed pelvis after a freak accident

programme.title: One Born Every Minute
programme.desc: Its all hands on deck as Southmead Hospitals maternity ward reaches maximum capacity, and the midwives are concerned that the unit may have to close. Among the new arrivals are Mormon couple Jennie and Jon, who are expecting their third child, and nervous first-time parents Eve and Andy, who experienced difficulties during their two previous pregnancies

programme.title: My Family
programme.desc: The Harpers gather to celebrate Christmas once more - although unlike previous festive specials, this one reveals how the family will be faring 30 years from now. Ben is in his eighties and still as grumpy as ever, thanks to a little moisturiser Susan has not aged a bit, Janey is tipping the scales at a whopping 20 stone and Michael is trying to hide his baldness with an unconvincing wig. While Susan is put out that grandson Kenzo, now 38, has not come to visit for Christmas, Ben is quick to point out that they have had some of the worst festive holidays ever, and this one looks no different with a greed gift exchange, a rival cousin and a nativity play battle. Robert Lindsay and Zoe Wanamaker star, with a guest appearance from Nathaniel Parker. Festive special from 2009

programme.title: Simply Nigella
programme.desc: Food writer Nigella Lawson shares the origins of some of her ideas, revealing just how and why they came into being, including a bowl of steamed clams with Thai basil inspired by a holiday in Thailand. Her toasty olive oil granola was born out of a need to have a satisfying breakfast at the ready, while hunger pangs at the other end of the day led to a dish of griddled halloumi with a sweet chilli sauce. Finally, Nigellas friends are treated to a supper of griddled bavette steak, followed by a lemon pavlova

programme.title: Great British Railway Journeys
programme.desc: Michael Portillo begins the latest leg on the seafront at Felixstowe, where in January 1953 the town was engulfed in the worst flooding to hit England in the 20th century. In Norwich, he admires the Norman Cathedral, then traces the history of the postcode

programme.title: Great British Railway Journeys
programme.desc: At RAF Lakenheath, Michael Portillo discovers a slice of America dropped into the British countryside. In the market town of Brandon on the border between Norfolk and Suffolk, he visits Quorn Foods to find how a seemingly modern meat substitute emerged out of a post-war food crisis. Michael ends his journey in Cambridge, where he studied during the 1970s

programme.title: Great British Railway Journeys
programme.desc: Michael Portillo begins a journey from the Midlands to the West Country, beginning in Derby, where he visits the citys famous 19th-century railway works. In Leicester he looks back to the early 1970s, when around 10,000 Asians arrived in the city after being expelled from Uganda by the dictator Idi Amin. He also hears how meat rationing during the Second World War led to the birth of Walkers crisps, still produced in the city

programme.title: Great British Railway Journeys
programme.desc: Michael Portillos railway journey through the Midlands and West Country takes him to Coventry, where he recalls the destruction by the German Luftwaffe of the citys gothic cathedral in November 1940. He visits the factory of the London Electric Vehicle Company, manufacturers of the iconic London taxi, and then heads south to Royal Leamington Spa and the national centre for the Guide Dogs for the Blind

programme.title: My Kind of Town
programme.desc: Ian Hamilton and his guide dog Major visit Blairgowrie and Rattray in Perth and Kinross. He asks those who live there how they feel about the place and what its future might hold

programme.title: My Kind of Town
programme.desc: Ian Hamilton and his guide dog Major explore Annan in Dumfries and Galloway. Ian finds out how a town with such an important industrial history, including boat building, fishing and even nuclear power, is adapting to the modern world

programme.title: Trawlermen
programme.desc: Force 11 storms are expected in Peterhead, Aberdeenshire, meaning the fishing fleet is safely in harbour with just two boats out at sea. Ocean Ventures skipper John D Buchan is prepared to prove a point to his father and sail to the coast of Norway. Meanwhile, 30 miles off the Shetlands, Charlie and Charles McBride brave the weather to repay their debts

programme.title: Trawlermen
programme.desc: Father-and-son Charlie and Charles McBride have a disastrous week as they lose their fishing net and their boats hydraulic power is reduced. Jimmy Buchanan has worries of his own when he learns his engine will cost £70,000 to repair. Meanwhile, Chaz Bruce, the youngest skipper in Fraserburghs prawn fleet, braves force eight gales

programme.title: Trawlermen
programme.desc: Inexperienced skipper Chaz Bruce and his crew run into difficulty when a rope wraps around the boats propeller and the engine loses revs, but he is determined to prove himself. Meanwhile, disaster strikes for Jimmy Buchan, and captain Alan Watt heads for the North Atlantic

programme.title: Bangers and Cash
programme.desc: Theres an unlikely arrival at the North Yorkshire car auction - an Argentinian Army Mercedes G wagon that saw action in the Falklands War

programme.title: Bangers and Cash
programme.desc: Derek has three scooters to collect, while also finding room for a Daimler and a teardrop caravan

programme.title: Bangers and Cash: Restoring Classics
programme.desc: The team head for restoration in their Bedford Rascal Campervan. They also purchase a true British classic - a TR6 - which is almost too good to touch!

programme.title: Flipping Bangers
programme.desc: British car enthusiasts Will and Gus take on a Mazda MX-5 thats been given some real boy racer attitude, hoping to return it to its former glory

programme.title: Natural World
programme.desc: David Attenborough has a passion for birds eggs, which protect the young from the outside world at the same time as allowing them to breathe and are strong enough to withstand the full weight of an incubating parent and weak enough to allow a chick to break free. In this documentary, the broadcaster reveals the secrets of birds eggs from creation to hatching, exploring how they are made, the reasons behind their shape and their intrinsic purpose

programme.title: Attenboroughs Birds of Paradise
programme.desc: Among David Attenboroughs life-long passions are birds of paradise, which he has tracked all over the jungles of New Guinea to film their beautiful and often bizarre displays. In this documentary, he examines how and why these creatures have captivated explorers, naturalists, artists, film-makers and even royalty, investigating the myths surrounding their discovery 500 years ago, the latest extraordinary behaviour captured on camera and the science behind their beauty. He also travels to a state-of-the art facility in Qatar that houses the largest breeding group of these birds in the world

programme.title: Planet Earth
programme.desc: David Attenborough narrates the documentary exploring Earths natural history and the factors that have affected it. The first edition examines how the sun affects life on Earth through the seasons, following a polar bear preparing its cubs for a long journey to avoid becoming stranded on floating glaciers. Narrated by David Attenborough

programme.title: Planet Earth
programme.desc: A tour of the mightiest rivers in the world, from the deep waters of Siberias Lake Baikal, home to the worlds only freshwater seal, to the wetlands downstream of Earths tallest waterfall patrolled by frenzied piranhas. There is also footage of the lightning-quick ambush of wildebeest by crocodiles in Africa and macaque monkeys swimming underwater to catch crabs in Indonesia. Presented by David Attenborough

programme.title: Simon Reeves South America
programme.desc: The adventurer sets off on a journey through the continent, beginning in the remote and little-visited north-east. In Venezuela, Simon meets some of the thousands of migrants fleeing the economic collapse of their country, while he learns that neighbouring Guyana could be on the verge of its own oil boom. He also meets a gun-toting former warlord who is now one of Surinames most successful businessmen, and ends his journey in French Guiana, where he goes to the launch site of the European Space Agency

programme.title: Robson Green: Worlds Most Amazing Walks
programme.desc: Actor and keen rambler Robson Green embarks on a series of unforgettable walks along some of the worlds most awe-inspiring trails,starting with the iconic Hadrians Wall Path. Beginning at Heddon-on-the-Wall, Robson walks through rugged moorland, sweeping countryside, and historical ruins over a journey spanning 84 miles

programme.title: Flipping Bangers
programme.desc: British car enthusiasts Will and Gus take on a Mazda MX-5 thats been given some real boy racer attitude, hoping to return it to its former glory

programme.title: Bangers and Cash: Restoring Classics
programme.desc: The team head for restoration in their Bedford Rascal Campervan. They also purchase a true British classic - a TR6 - which is almost too good to touch!

programme.title: Bangers and Cash: Restoring Classics
programme.desc: A 1969 Morris Mini Cooper MkII is totally restored by specialists. They give it the full works, which means only one thing... any chance of profit heads towards an open window

programme.title: Bangers and Cash: Restoring Classics
programme.desc: The team set out on a pre-war challenge with a 1939 three-wheeled Morgan F4 - and aptly named Russ Storer from MG Mecca is still keen to take it on

programme.title: Bangers and Cash
programme.sub-title: Mini Cooper and Chevy Pick Up
programme.desc: Behind the scenes of a North Yorkshire-based, family-run historic car auction business. Featured vehicles include a Mini Cooper and Chevrolet Pick-up truck

programme.title: Bangers and Cash
programme.desc: A rare 1980s Sierra Cosworth draws in a crowd of admiring Ford fans, while a restorer delights buyers with his immaculate 1966 Sunbeam Rapier and Sarah takes a shine to a caravan

programme.title: Great British Railway Journeys
programme.desc: Michael Portillos railway journey through the Midlands and West Country takes him to Coventry, where he recalls the destruction by the German Luftwaffe of the citys gothic cathedral in November 1940. He visits the factory of the London Electric Vehicle Company, manufacturers of the iconic London taxi, and then heads south to Royal Leamington Spa and the national centre for the Guide Dogs for the Blind

programme.title: Great British Railway Journeys
programme.desc: Michael Portillo reaches Warwickshire, where he gets a glimpse of the work being done for the new HS2 railway infrastructure. In Stratford-upon-Avon he learns about the founding of the Royal Shakespeare Company, before a visit to Birmingham, where he recalls the redevelopment of the city centre during the 1960s and the arrival of black and Asian communities

programme.title: Great British Railway Journeys
programme.desc: Michael Portillo stops in Wolverhampton, where he finds out about the impact of Enoch Powells 1968 speech. He also visits Kingsford Country Park on the outskirts of Kidderminster, investigates pigeon-racing in Worcester, and eventually looks into Cheltenhams jazz festival

programme.title: Great British Railway Journeys
programme.desc: From Tewkesbury in Gloucestershire, Michael Portillo heads to the castle of Eastnor at the foot of the Malvern Hills. He also visits Coleford in the Forest of Dean, Slimbridge in Gloucestershire, and Bristol Temple Meads. From there he heads to Filton to investigate the centre of Britains post-war aviation industry

programme.title: Bangers and Cash
programme.desc: Derek auctions off a Jensen Interceptor and a Jensen Healey along with a one-off Wood and Pickett Triumph Dolomite Sprint. Sarah takes a shine to a four-tonne road roller

programme.title: Bangers and Cash
programme.desc: A 1971 Mercedes SL and a 1989 Jaguar XJS emerge from a barn on a chicken farm, a Roller and a Rover go under the hammer and a 1966 Triumph Spitfire is restored to near perfection

programme.title: Secret Nazi Bases
programme.desc: Deep in the forests of East Prussia, a sprawling Nazi complex becomes the nerve centre of Hitlers empire - and the site of a daring plot against the Fuhrer

programme.title: The World at War
programme.desc: Acclaimed chronicle of the Second World War, beginning with an account of Hitlers ascent to power at a time when the Germans were stricken by humiliating military defeat, runaway inflation and economic depression. The Nazi leaders promises of regained national pride and prosperity struck a chord with millions of ordinary citizens, and he was elected on a tidal wave of popular support. Narrated by Laurence Olivier

programme.title: Antiques Roadshow
programme.desc: Fiona Bruce and the team visit Lincoln Cathedral, where objects brought to be valued include a set of surgeons tools from the 1860s and a plate that has spent years hidden in a cupboard. Plus, a man who is trying to recover his grandfathers paintings explains his quest

programme.title: Antiques Roadshow
programme.desc: The team revisits Lincoln Cathedral, where items examined include a Georgian dining table, a Chinese picture bought for very little, and a collection of early TV implements used to screen the Queens coronation

programme.title: Bangers and Cash
programme.desc: Daves on his way to Grimsby to pick up an iconic 80s fast Ford, the Mk1 Fiesta XR2, while Bubbles regrets sitting in an immaculate Morris 1800 which hes now desperate to bid on

programme.title: Bangers and Cash
programme.desc: Derek gets a tour of Hadlow Castle in Kent when he arrives to collect the owners pre-war Alvis and an immaculate Citroen used by the Gestapo in occupied France

programme.title: Secret Nazi Bases
programme.desc: Deep in the forests of East Prussia, a sprawling Nazi complex becomes the nerve centre of Hitlers empire - and the site of a daring plot against the Fuhrer

programme.title: The World at War
programme.desc: Acclaimed chronicle of the Second World War, beginning with an account of Hitlers ascent to power at a time when the Germans were stricken by humiliating military defeat, runaway inflation and economic depression. The Nazi leaders promises of regained national pride and prosperity struck a chord with millions of ordinary citizens, and he was elected on a tidal wave of popular support. Narrated by Laurence Olivier

programme.title: Antiques Roadshow
programme.desc: Fiona Bruce and the team visit Lincoln Cathedral, where objects brought to be valued include a set of surgeons tools from the 1860s and a plate that has spent years hidden in a cupboard. Plus, a man who is trying to recover his grandfathers paintings explains his quest

programme.title: Indian Ocean with Simon Reeve
programme.desc: Adventurer Simon Reeve sets out to travel around the coastline of the Indian Ocean, journeying by boat, car, train and plane as he takes in 16 countries. He starts on the tip of South Africa, where he dives with ragged-tooth sharks and joins conservationists helping to save the endangered African penguin, before heading into Cape Town, where he has a close encounter with a drug dealer. Moving on, he hitches a boat to Mozambique, where a nervous captain reveals the threat posed by Somali pirates, and completes this leg of his journey in Zanzibar, a tropical island steeped in the long history of the slave trade

programme.title: Robson Green: Worlds Most Amazing Walks

programme.title: Bangers and Cash

programme.title: Bangers and Cash

programme.title: Agatha Christies Poirot
programme.desc: The sleuth falls victim to depression after failing to prevent the murder of a society girl by notorious art thief Marrascaud. His confidence shattered, Poirot eventually returns to work when a lonely chauffeur begs him to find his missing soulmate, the maid of a famous Russian dancer. The investigation takes him to the Swiss Alps, where, against all odds, he stumbles upon a hotel thought to be Marrascauds hideout - leading to a very personal showdown. The penultimate episode of the long-running detective drama, starring David Suchet, with Simon Callow, Orla Brady, Patrick Ryecart, Nigel Lindsay, Morven Christie, Tom Austen and Rupert Evans

programme.title: Doc Martin
programme.desc: After having his career scrutinised by the General Medical Council because of his blood phobia, Martin makes efforts to overcome his fear and begins to question whether he made the right decision about resigning. Comedy drama, starring Martin Clunes and Caroline Catz

programme.title: Marcus Wareings Tales from a Kitchen Garden
programme.desc: The Michelin-starred chef preserves the last of his summer crops so that they can be enjoyed through the winter, and also throws a party

programme.desc: The comedian makes another journey to Battersea Dogs and Cats Home. programme.title: The Magical Land of Oz
programme.desc: The natural landscape of Australia, a place of ancient wonders, big skies and jewelled seas. Its abundance of wildlife features acrobatic crocodiles, tree-climbing birds, fish that cross roads and spiders who dance like peacocks

programme.title: Titanic
programme.desc: Italian stoker Mario blags a job on the Titanic for his brother Paolo, who is instantly smitten with cabin steward Annie, and as the ship sets sail he startles her with an impulsive gesture. Barnes is surprised to find Watson loitering in steerage, while Mary lets her guard down with Peter Lubov, much to the anger of husband Jim. But any arguments are set aside when the ship strikes the iceberg - and fear quickly builds for the third-class passengers as some of them are behind locked gates

programme.title: The Night Caller
programme.desc: Former science teacher Tony Conroy now works the night shift as a taxi driver in Liverpool, living a solitary life as he drifts through the monotony of picking up and dropping off passengers night in and night out. After an uncomfortable conversation with a former colleague, Tony feels a desperate need to talk to someone and decides to call late-night radio show NightTalk. Thriller, starring Robert Glenister and Sean Pertwee

programme.title: Michael Palin in North Korea
programme.desc: Michael leaves Pyongyang and is put under the protection of armed guards as he is shown the Joint Security Area on the border with South Korea, where he has a tense exchange with a lieutenant from the Korean Peoples Army about the Korean War and the DPRKs nuclear weapons programme. He also travels to the east coast of the country and the seaside town of Wonsan, where he sees a massive tourist resort being constructed on the beach, although the nearby new international airport for an expected influx of passengers remains eerily empty

programme.title: Poldark
programme.desc: Period drama based on the novels by Winston Graham, originally adapted into a successful 1970s TV series. In late 18th-century Cornwall, Ross Poldark joins the army to avoid charges of smuggling, leaving behind his loved one Elizabeth - and when he returns three years later, having fought in the American War of Independence, he finds his father dead, his estate in ruins and his sweetheart engaged to another man. In need of help, he takes on a new kitchen maid after rescuing her from a beating - bringing him into conflict with hostile locals. Aidan Turner takes the title role, with Eleanor Tomlinson, Heida Reed, Phil Davis and Warren Clarke

Rural drama, starring Ruth Platt, Robert Hands, Mark Jordan and Craig Heaney

Negotiations for the sale of the country house are taking place during the gathering, but when new owner Count Ludwig of Austria is found murdered, St Mary Meads elderly spinster must identify the culprit. Whodunit, starring Julia McKenzie, with a supporting cast including Gavin and Stacey stars Ruth Jones and Mathew Horne, plus Dervla Kirwan, Charlotte Salt, Michelle Collins, Jonas Armstrong and Edward Fox
